title: Data Scientist
description:
This role is for one of the Weekday's clients

Overview

The Data Scientist plays a crucial role in harnessing the power of data to drive decision-making processes and enhance business performance. This role involves analyzing complex datasets to derive actionable insights, utilizing advanced analytical techniques ranging from statistical analysis to machine learning algorithms. By leveraging big data technologies and programming skills, the Data Scientist provides the organization with a competitive edge, informing strategy and optimizing operations. As a key team member, the Data Scientist collaborates with cross-functional teams, interpreting data and translating findings into clear concepts for stakeholders. This position is vital for organizations aiming to use data-driven techniques to support innovation and growth, developing models that can predict outcomes and improve overall efficiency.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and preprocess data from various sources.
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends and patterns.
Develop predictive models using machine learning algorithms.
Design and implement data visualization solutions for stakeholders.
Collaborate with software engineers to integrate data solutions into applications.
Conduct statistical analyses to validate model effectiveness.
Work closely with business units to understand their data needs.
Present findings and insights to management and non-technical stakeholders.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in data science and technologies.
Develop and maintain documentation for data science projects.
Perform quality assurance on data products to ensure accuracy.
Engage in A/B testing and experiments to validate hypotheses.
Optimize existing data processes for efficiency improvements.
Mentor junior data analysts and scientists.
Lead projects from inception through implementation to evaluate results.


Required Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field.
Master's degree or Ph.D. in a relevant field is preferred.
A minimum of 3 years of experience in data science or a related area.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.
Strong understanding of statistical methods and concepts.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, Scikit-Learn).
Familiarity with big data technologies such as Hadoop or Spark.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Experience in handling large datasets.
Knowledge of database systems (SQL/NoSQL).
Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented environment.
Strong attention to detail and a commitment to quality.
Experience in deploying data-driven solutions in production.
Continuous learner with a passion for data science and technology.
